required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of a Urethral Catheter Coated With Eluting Silver Salts (SUCCESS)
clinical_study.official_title: Study of a Urethral Catheter Coated With Eluting Silver Salts

brief_summary.textblock: Urinary catheters are often needed in hospital patients, but their use can increase the chance that a catheter associated urinary tract infection (called a CAUTI) may occur. This study will try to determine if patients who get a new silver coated catheter will have slower to time to development of a CAUTI compared to patients who get an uncoated catheter.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, multicenter, randomized controlled pivotal study designed to compare the time to occurrence and incidence of CAUTI in subjects catheterized with a new hydrogel-silver salts latex catheter (test) to those of subjects catheterized with a silicone elastomer-coated latex catheter (control).

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Occurrence of Bacteriuric Urinary Tract Infection (bUTI) in Subjects Catheterized for >= 48 Hours
primary_outcome.description: Time to occurrence of bUTI in subjects of both study groups who were catheterized with a study catheter for >= 48 hours and who had evidence of bUTI after study catheter insertion. Subjects who did not have a bUTI are not included in the median calculation, so the median only includes data from non-censored observations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a bUTI After Catheterization for >= 48 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of bUTI was calculated as the rate of new occurrence of bUTI in subjects of both study groups who had been catheterized with a study catheter for >= 48 hours and who did not have evidence of bUTI at the time of study catheter insertion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Occurence of Symptomatic Urinary Tract Infection (sUTI) in Subjects Catheterized for >= 48 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: The time to occurrence of sUTI was measured as the time between catheter insertion and when the criteria for sUTI was met, up to 10 days after catheterization plus 48 hours after catheter removal. Subjects who did not have a sUTI are not included in the median calculation, so the median only includes data from non-censored observations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Occurence of bUTI in Subjects Catheterized for >= 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: Time to occurrence of bUTI in subjects of both study groups who were catheterized with a study catheter for >= 24 hours and developed a bUTI at after catheter insertion. Subjects who did not have a bUTI are not included in the median calculation, so the median only includes data from non-censored observations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Occurance of sUTI in Subjects Catheterized for >= 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: The time to occurrence of sUTI was measured as the time between catheter insertion and when the criteria for sUTI was met, up to 10 days after catheterization plus 48 hours after catheter removal. Subjects who did not have a sUTI are not included in the median calculation, so the median only includes data from non-censored observations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bacteriuria at a Concentration of ≥ 10e3 < 10e5 CFU/mL
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with bacteriuria levels ≥ 10e3 < 10e5 CFU/mL who subsequently developed a bUTI or a sUTI

other_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a bUTI Catheterized for >=48 Hours.
other_outcome.time_frame: From time of catheterization until 10 days post catheterization or 48 hours after catheter removal.
other_outcome.description: bUTI occurences were counted in subjects of both study groups who had been catheterized with a study catheter for >= 48 hours and who did not have evidence of bUTI at the time of study catheter insertion.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a sUTI Catheterized for >=48 Hours.
other_outcome.time_frame: From time of catheterization until 10 days or 48 hours after catheter was removed
other_outcome.description: sUTI occurences were counted in subjects of both study groups who had been catheterized with a study catheter for >= 48 hours and who did not have evidence of bUTI at the time of study catheter insertion.

arm_group.description: Bard Hydrogel Silver Salts Coated Latex Urinary Catheter System
Bard silicone elastomer coated latex catheter system

intervention.intervention_name: Hydrogel Silver Salts Coated Latex Urinary Catheter System
Bard silicone elastomer coated latex catheter system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female at least 18 years of age
- life expectancy of 3 months or more
- expected to require a urinary catheter for at least 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- recent urinary tract surgery or instrumentation
- presence of a urinary tract device
- concurrent genitourinary tract infection
- recent indwelling urinary catheter
- requires use of a non-study urinary catheter

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Twenty Investigators at 20 Investigative Sites enrolled a total of 1188 study subjects between June 28, 2007 and June 23, 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects judged by site personnel to require a urinary catheter for at least 48-72 hours were screened against the study inclusion/exclusion criteria. Those subjects meeting these criteria were offered participation in the study.

group.title: Silver-coated Catheter
group.description: Bard® Hydrogel Silver Salts Coated Latex Urinary Catheter

participants_list.participants: 599 subjects were enrolled in the silver-coated catheter group.
589 subjects were enrolled in the silicone-coated catheter group.
Out of the 599 AgCS subjects 565 (94.3%) had a successful catheterization.
Out of the 589 SiCS catheter subjects 568 (96.4%) had a successful catheterization.
426 went on to be included in the Silver-coated 48 hour efficacy evaluable population.
428 went on to be included in the Silicone-coated 48 hour efficacy evaluable population.

group.title: Silver-coated Catheter
group.description: Bard® Hydrogel Silver Salts Coated Latex Urinary Catheter

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a bUTI After Catheterization for >= 48 Hours
outcome.description: The percentage of bUTI was calculated as the rate of new occurrence of bUTI in subjects of both study groups who had been catheterized with a study catheter for >= 48 hours and who did not have evidence of bUTI at the time of study catheter insertion.
outcome.population: Efficacy Evaluable (48) population: ITT subjects who were catheterized with a study catheter for ≥ 48 hours and who did not have a bUTI in the baseline urine sample obtained at the time of catheter insertion.

group.title: Silver-coated Catheter
group.description: Bard® Hydrogel Silver Salts Coated Latex Urinary Catheter

outcome.description: Time to occurrence of bUTI in subjects of both study groups who were catheterized with a study catheter for >= 48 hours and who had evidence of bUTI after study catheter insertion. Subjects who did not have a bUTI are not included in the median calculation, so the median only includes data from non-censored observations.
outcome.population: Efficacy Evaluable (48) population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) subjects who were catheterized with a study catheter for ≥ 48 hours and who developed a bUTI after catheter insertion.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from the time of attempted or successful catheter insertion throughout the period of catheterization with the study catheter and for a period of 48 hours following study catheter removal, or until hospital discharge.
reported_events.desc: AE Definition: any undesirable clinical occurrence in a subject that is related to either the urinary tract, or systemic infection. All SAEs were collected, as defined in 21 CFR 803.3.

group.title: Silver-coated Catheter
group.description: Bard® Hydrogel Silver Salts Coated Latex Urinary Catheter

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Sample size calculations required 1244 Efficacy Evaluable 48 subjects, only 854 Efficacy Evaluable 48 subjects were enrolled, which does not allow for a fully powered study and there is the threat of a type II error (false negative result).
